meanings.definition: To interrupt the quiet, rest, peace, or order of; unsettle
meanings.sent1: The loud noise disturbs my sleep every night.
meanings.sent2: Please do not disturb the class while they are taking a test.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy disturbs the calm of the house with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news disturbed the tranquility of the peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm disturbed the peaceful afternoon with its loud thunder.

meanings.sent1: The phone call disturbed our conversation at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: I hope my loud music does not disturb the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The noisy birds disturbed the quiet of the early morning.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor disturbed the flow of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog disturbed the silence of the night with its loud howls.

meanings.definition: To agitate or stir up; arouse from a state of rest
meanings.sent1: The strong winds disturb the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent2: Please do not disturb the settled dust on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child disturbed the sleeping cat by poking it.
meanings.sent4: The controversial topic disturbed the peace among the friends.
meanings.sent5: The loud music disturbed the quiet atmosphere of the library.
